evidence.text: plaintiff’s cross-motion for summary judgment [Dkt. #23] will be GRANTED, and defendants’ motion for summary judgment [Dkt. #22] will be DENIED.

extracted.value: The court granted the plaintiff's cross-motion for summary judgment (Dkt. #23) and denied the defendants' motion for summary judgment (Dkt. #22).

evidence.text: It is DECLARED that plaintiff Hampton Dellinger is the Special Counsel of the Office of Special Counsel, having been appointed by the President and confirmed by the United States Senate on February 27, 2024.

extracted.value: The court declared that Hampton Dellinger is the Special Counsel of the Office of Special Counsel, having been appointed by the President and confirmed by the United States Senate on February 27, 2024.

evidence.text: It is further DECLARED that the February 7, 2025 email from the Assistant to the President, Director of Presidential Personnel Office, The White House, announcing plaintiff’s termination was an unlawful, ultra vires act in violation of 5 U.S.C. §1211(b). Therefore, it is null and void, and plaintiff is and shall be the Special Counsel of the Office of Special Counsel for the remainder of his five-year term unless and until he is removed in accordance with 5 U.S.C. §1211(b).

extracted.value: The court declared that the February 7, 2025 email from the White House announcing Dellinger's termination was an unlawful, ultra vires act in violation of 5 U.S.C. §1211(b), and therefore null and void, with Dellinger remaining Special Counsel for the remainder of his five-year term unless removed under statutory provisions.

evidence.text: It is further DECLARED that any recognition of an Acting Special Counsel in his place is unlawful.

extracted.value: The court declared that any recognition of an Acting Special Counsel in Dellinger's place is unlawful.

evidence.text: As of the date of this order, March 1, 2025, through the expiration of plaintiff’s five-year term as Special Counsel, defendants Bessent, Gor, Gorman, Kammann, and Vought must recognize plaintiff’s title and position as Special Counsel of the Office of Special Counsel; they must not obstruct or interfere with his performance of his duties; they must not deny him the authority, benefits, or resources of his office; they must not recognize any Acting Special Counsel in his place; and they must not treat him in any way as if he has been removed, or recognize any other person as Special Counsel or as the head of the Office of Special Counsel, unless and until he is removed from office in accordance with 5 U.S.C. §1211(b).

extracted.value: The court enjoined defendants from obstructing Dellinger's duties, denying him office resources, or recognizing any Acting Special Counsel, and ordered them to recognize him as Special Counsel for the remainder of his five-year term.

evidence.text: defendants’ motion to stay the Court’s order pending appeal [Dkt. #36] is DENIED.

extracted.value: The court denied defendants’ motion to stay the Court’s order pending appeal [Dkt. #36].

evidence.text: it is ORDERED that the emergency motion for a stay pending appeal be granted, and that the district court’s March 1, 2025 order be stayed pending further order of the court, except to the extent that order vacates the Temporary Restraining Order entered by the district court on February 12, 2025.

extracted.value: The court granted the emergency motion for a stay pending appeal, staying the district court’s March 1, 2025 order pending further order of the court, except as it vacates the February 12, 2025 Temporary Restraining Order.
